home.what: Meeting Media Manager, or M¬≥ for short, is an app for Windows, macOS and Linux, that automatically downloads pictures and videos that will be considered during congregation meetings of Jehovah's Witnesses, in any language found on JW.org.
home.summary: It features recurring and custom media management, as well as an optional sync feature for members of the same congregation, as well as support for multiple congregations and/or groups using the same computer account.
home.m3Can: M¬≥ allows you to easily and automatically download, synchronize, share and present all meeting media.
home.presentMode: For hybrid or in-person congregation meetings, the integrated media presentation mode has all the features needed to simplify the task of sharing media with the congregation, including:
home.playback: Easy-to-use pause/play/stop buttons to manage playback of media files
home.music: Easy background music playback, with automatic stop before the start of regularly scheduled meetings
home.monitors: Automatic external monitor recognition and management
home.remote: As for fully remote congregation Zoom meetings, the inbuilt MP4 conversion feature in M¬≥ enables you to share media files of all types easily, using Zoom's native MP4 sharing feature.
home.doesM3Work: Does M¬≥ work in my language?
home.m3Works: Yes! Media for meetings of Jehovah's Witnesses can be automatically downloaded in any of the hundreds of language that are available on JW.org. The list of available languages is dynamically updated; all you need to do is select which one you want.
home.m3Translated: In addition, M¬≥ itself has been translated into 12 languages and counting, by many volunteers; you can therefore configure the language you would like to be displayed in M¬≥'s interface.
home.closing: This app is made with love and a bit of spare time. Enjoy!

bug-feature.report: How do I report an issue or bug I encountered?

bug-feature.request: How can I request new features?
bug-feature.ghDiscussions: I'm open to suggestions! Please use [GH DISCUSSIONS] to discuss potential new features.

configuration.settingsScreen: The Settings screen is divided into 4 sections. Most of the options are self-explanatory, but here are a few additional details.
configuration.appLangDesc: Sets the language in which M¬≥ is displayed.
configuration.thankContributors: Thank you to our many contributors for translating the app in so many languages!
configuration.askHelp: If you want to help improve an existing translation or add a new one, please open up a new [GH DISCUSSION].
configuration.mediaSaveFolder: Folder in which to save media
configuration.folderDesc: Meeting media will be saved to this folder for later sharing and use.
configuration.startupDesc: If enabled, M¬≥ will launch when the current user logs into the computer.
configuration.syncDesc: If enabled, this option will automatically initiate a media sync 5 seconds after M¬≥ is launched.
configuration.syncNote: To prevent the automatic sync from occurring when this setting is enabled, press the ‚è∏ (pause) button before the 5-second timer is up.
configuration.openFolderDesc: When enabled, the folder containing the downloaded media for the chosen week will open in the computer's file manager after the media sync is complete.
configuration.quitDesc: If enabled, this option will automatically quit M¬≥ 5 seconds after the media sync is complete.
configuration.quitNote: To prevent M¬≥ from quitting automatically when this setting is enabled, press the üèÉ (person leaving/running) button before the 5-second timer is up.
configuration.obsDesc: If enabled, this option will tap into OBS Studio to change scenes automatically as needed both before and after sharing media.
configuration.obsWebsocket: If enabling this setting, make sure that OBS Studio is configured to use the obs-websocket plugin, which is what will enable M¬≥ to communicate with OBS Studio.
configuration.obsScenes: Also, configure all needed scenes for media sharing and stage display in OBS.
configuration.obsScenesMin: At the very least, you'll need a scene with a Window Capture (recommended) or Display Capture configured to capture the M¬≥ media presentation window, or the screen on which the media will be presented.
configuration.obsAlso: You'll also need to configure all desired stage view scenes, for example:
configuration.obsStage: a wide shot of the stage
configuration.obsLecturnReader: the lectern and reader mics together
configuration.obsPortDesc: Port on which the obs-websocket plugin is configured to listen.
configuration.obsPassDesc: Password configured in the obs-websocket plugin's settings.
configuration.obsCameraScene: Default stage view scene in OBS Studio
configuration.obsCameraDesc: Select which scene should be selected by default when media presentation mode is launched. Usually a stage wide view, or a shot of the lectern.
configuration.obsMediaScene: Media window scene in OBS Studio
configuration.obsMediaDesc: Select which scene is configured in OBS Studio to capture the M¬≥ media window.
configuration.disableHADesc: Only enable this setting if you are experiencing issues with media presentation mode. Changing this setting will cause M¬≥ to restart.
configuration.congLink: See the [CONG LINK] section for details on what this does exactly and how to configure this section.
configuration.mediaLangDesc: Select the language of your congregation or group. All media will be downloaded from JW.org in this language.
configuration.resDesc: Videos downloaded from JW.org will be downloaded at this resolution, or the next available lower resolution. Useful for limited or low-bandwidth situations.
configuration.convertDesc: This will automatically convert all picture and audio files into MP4 format, for use with Zoom's [NATIVE FEATURE] during fully remote congregation Zoom meetings.
configuration.convertExplain: This includes all pictures and media files downloaded from JW.org, as well as additional media files added by the user or the VO.
configuration.convertNote: Note: This option is best suited for remote-only congregation Zoom meetings.
configuration.convertPresentLink: If conducting either hybrid or regular congregation meetings, look into using [PRESENT LINK] by activating the [PRESENT] option instead, and disable this option.
configuration.keepOriginalsAfterConversion: Keep original media files after conversion
configuration.keepDesc: If this setting is enabled, picture and audio files will be kept in the media folder after converting them to MP4 format, rather than being deleted.
configuration.keepResult: This will result in a slightly more cluttered media folder, and generally does not need to be enabled if sharing media through Zoom MP4 sharing.
configuration.keepNote: Note: Only visible if [CONVERT] is also enabled.
configuration.enableMediaDisplayButton: Present media on an external monitor or in a separate window
configuration.presentDesc: This setting will allow you to use M¬≥ to present pictures, videos and audio files during hybrid or in-person congregation meetings.
configuration.presentLink: [PRESENT MODE] can then be accessed by clicking the ‚ñ∂Ô∏è (play) button on the main screen of M¬≥.
configuration.presentExplain: The media presentation screen will automatically use an external monitor if present; if not, the media will be displayed in a separate, resizable window.
configuration.presentNote: Note: This option is best suited for either hybrid or regular congregation meetings.
configuration.presentConvertLink: If conducting remote-only congregation Zoom meetings, look into activating the [CONVERT] option and sharing the media with Zoom's native MP4 sharing instead.
configuration.mediaWindowBackground: Background image for media presentation mode
configuration.bgDesc: By default, M¬≥ will attempt to fetch the current year's text in the language selected previously, in order to display it on a black background when in [PRESENT MODE] and no other media is being played.
configuration.bgFails: If the automatic yeartext retrieval fails for some reason, or if you wish to display a different background image, you can either use the 'Browse' button to select a custom picture, or the 'Refresh' button to try fetching the yeartext automatically again.
configuration.bgNote: Note: If [CONG SYNC] is enabled, selecting a custom background image will synchronize it for all congregation sync users automatically.
configuration.vlcDesc: Enable this if you want to generate playlists for every meeting automatically, which can then be loaded in VLC, if you are using that app to display media instead of [PRESENT MODE].
configuration.excludeTh: Exclude all media from the th brochure
configuration.thDesc: If enabled, this will prevent media from the Apply Yourself brochure from being included at every midweek meeting.
configuration.excludeLffi: Exclude audio and video files from the lffi brochure
configuration.lffiDesc: If enabled, this will prevent audio and video files from the Live Forever brochure (lffi) from being included, for example for student assignments during the midweek meeting.
configuration.lffiNote: Images from the lffi brochure are not affected by this setting.
configuration.lffiImgDesc: If enabled, this will prevent images from the Live Forever brochure (lffi) from being included, for example for student assignments during the midweek meeting.
configuration.lffiImgNote: Audio and video files from the lffi brochure are not affected by this setting.
configuration.mwDesc: Indicate the usual day and time for the midweek meeting; used for folder naming and automatic background music fade-out (see below).
configuration.weDesc: Indicate the usual day and time for the weekend meeting.
configuration.enableMusicButton: Enable button to play Kingdom songs on shuffle
configuration.musicDesc: Enable a button on the main screen which will play Kingdom songs from the sjjm series, in random order.
configuration.musicNote: This is useful, for example, to play songs before and after meetings at the Kingdom Hall as background music.
configuration.volDesc: Sets the volume at which the background music will play.
configuration.fadeDesc: If [MUSIC OPTION] is active, then this setting will allow you to specify a delay after which background music should be automatically stopped.
configuration.fadeMeeting: a predetermined number of seconds before the start of the meeting (in the case where the background music was started before a meeting).

congregation-sync.vo: The brother designated as videoconference organizer (VO) by the body of elders can use M¬≥ to manage what media is made available to the technical A/V support team in his congregation.
congregation-sync.voCan: The VO, or someone designated by him, can:
congregation-sync.additional: upload additionalstrong> media to be shared during a meeting, such as for the circuit overseer's visit, or for public speakers' talks
congregation-sync.hide: hide media from JW.org that isn't relevant for a given meeting, for example, when a part has been replaced by the local branch
congregation-sync.recurring: add or remove recurring media, such as a year-text video, or an announcement slide
congregation-sync.synced: All who are synced to the same congregation will then receive the exact samemedia when they click the [FETCH] button.
congregation-sync.note: Please note that the congregation sync feature is opt-in and entirely optional.
congregation-sync.webdav: M¬≥'s underlying sync mechanism uses WebDAV. This means that the VO (or someone under his supervision) needs to either:
congregation-sync.webdavServer: set up a secured WebDAV server that is web-accessible, or
congregation-sync.externalWebdav: use a third-party cloud storage service that supports the WebDAV protocol (see the [HOSTNAME] setting in the [CONG SYNC] section below).
congregation-sync.credentials: All users that wish to be synchronized together will need to connect to the same WebDAV server using the connection information and credentials provided to them by their VO.
congregation-sync.hostDesc: Web address of the WebDAV server. Secure HTTP (HTTPS) is required.
congregation-sync.hostNote: Note: The label for this field is actually a button that, once clicked, will show a list of WebDAV providers that have been known to be compatible with M¬≥, and will automatically prefill certain settings for those providers.
congregation-sync.hostList: This list is provided as a courtesy, and in no way represents an endorsement of any particular service or provider.
congregation-sync.hostBest: The best server is always the one you own...
congregation-sync.portDesc: Usually 443 for standard HTTPS, but might differ depending on the site.
congregation-sync.passNote: Note: As detailed in their respective support pages, an app-specific password might need to be created for [BOX] and [KOOFR] in order to enable WebDAV connections to their services.
congregation-sync.folderDesc: This is the folder that will be used to synchronize media for all congregation sync users.
congregation-sync.folderChoices: You can either type/paste in a path, or use your mouse to navigate to the target folder.
congregation-sync.folderNote: Note: Make sure that all congregation sync users input the same folder path; otherwise the sync won't work as expected.
congregation-sync.settingsDesc: Once the VO has configured the [MEDIA SETUP] and [MEETINGSETUP] sections of the [SETTINGS] on his own computer, he can then use this button to enforce certain settings for all congregation sync users
congregation-sync.settingsExample: (for example, meeting days, media language, conversion settings, and so on).
congregation-sync.settingsNote: This means that the selected settings will be forcefully applied for all synced users every time they open M¬≥.
congregation-sync.usingCongSync: Using congregation sync to manage media
congregation-sync.usageDesc: Once the congregation sync setup is complete, you're ready to start [MANAGE MEDIA] for your congregation's technical AV support team.
congregation-sync.screenshots: Screenshots of congregation sync in action

faq.depends: Does this app depend on external sites, sources or "curators" to download publications and meeting media?
faq.dependsAns: No. The app behaves similarly to JW Library.
faq.dependsExplain: It downloads publications and media directly from the official JW.org website and its content delivery network.
faq.dependsRuntime: At runtime, the app automatically determines what needs to be downloaded, such as media files and publications.
faq.dependsSource: The source code is available for all to examine and verify this.
faq.infringe: Does this app infringe the JW.org Terms of Use?
faq.infringeAns: No. The JW.org [TERMS] actually explicitly allow the kind of usage that we are making.
faq.infringeExplain: Here is the relevant excerpt from those terms (emphasis mine):
faq.termsCreate: Create for distribution purposes, any software applications, tools, or techniques that are specifically made to collect, copy, download, extract, harvest, or scrape data, HTML, images, or text from this site.
faq.termsCan: (This does not prohibit the distribution of free, non-commercial applications designed to download electronic files such as EPUB, PDF, MP3, and MP4 files from public areas of this site.)

installation.adminPriv: M¬≥ does not require administrative privileges to install or run.
installation.install: To install M¬≥, simply [DOWNLOAD] and run it.
installation.configure: Configure the app using the [SETTINGS] screen.

usage-notes.run: The app should run as is on most modern computers running Windows, Linux, or Mac.
usage-notes.winError: On opening the installer, you might get an [ERROR] indicating that "Windows SmartScreen prevented an unrecognized app from starting".
usage-notes.winErrorExplain: This is due to the app not having a high number of downloads, and consequently not being explicitly "trusted" by Windows.
usage-notes.winErrorSolution: To get around this, simply click on "More info", then "Run anyway".

usage-notes.linIfZero: If the output is 0, then the AppImage will not run unless you run the following command, followed by a reboot:
usage-notes.linArticle: Make sure you read up on [LINK] before you do this.
usage-notes.macArticle: If upon launching the app, you receive a warning that the app cannot be opened, either because "it was not downloaded from the App store" or because "the developer cannot be verified", then this [PAGE] will help you to get past that.
usage-notes.macWarning: If you get a message indicating that you "do not have permission to open the application", then try some solutions from [LINK].
usage-notes.macExample: For example, you could try running this command in Terminal:
usage-notes.macUnlike: Unlike Windows and Linux, auto-update functionality is not implemented on macOS, and for technical reasons probably never will be.
usage-notes.macHowever: However, one of two things will happen for Mac users when an update is available:
usage-notes.macDownload: M¬≥ will attempt to download the update package and open it automatically, after which the user will have to manually complete the installation of the M¬≥ update by dragging and dropping the updated app to their Applications folder.
usage-notes.macThen: Then, they will be able to launch the newly updated M¬≥ from their Applications folder as usual.
usage-notes.macFails: If the previous step fails at any stage, M¬≥ will display a persistent notification indicating that an update is available, with a link to the update itself.
usage-notes.macButton: A red, pulsing notification will also be displayed on the settings button in the main screen of M¬≥.
usage-notes.macVersion: The M¬≥ version number in the settings screen will turn into a button that, once clicked, opens the latest release's download page automatically.

manage-media.summary: The media management screen allows the user to add or remove media for any given meeting, manage recurring media, and even add special media for other dates on which no meeting is normally scheduled.
manage-media.manage: Managing media for any particular day
manage-media.manageDesc: To manage media for a certain meeting or day, simply click on that day's tile on the main screen of M¬≥.
manage-media.manageRecurring: To manage media that be repeated at every meeting, click on the Recurring media tile.
manage-media.mediaAddHow: Here's how to add media from the media management screen.
manage-media.explainType: Choose from one of the 3 media types. (See below.)
manage-media.explainMedia: Depends on the media type chosen. (See below.)
manage-media.explainPrefix: Up to 6 digits can be added before the media filename(s), to help with sorting.
manage-media.explainList: This shows the currently planned media for the selected date tile.
manage-media.explainAdd: In the [MEDIA] field, you'll be presented with different options, depending on the media type selected.
manage-media.songDesc: ... show a menu with all Kingdom song videos from the sjjm series, in the media language.
manage-media.songChoose: Choose this option for example to add a song for the public talk, or for circuit overseer visits.
manage-media.songNote: The selected song will be automatically downloaded from JW.org, in the congregation or group's language, as configured in the [SETTINGS].
manage-media.jwpubDesc: ... allow you to browse to (or drag and drop) a JWPUB file.
manage-media.jwpubPromted: You'll then be prompted to select the section, or chapter, from which you'd like to add media.
manage-media.jwpubAdd: This will add both embedded and referenced media from that section in the JWPUB file.
manage-media.jwpubNote: An example of a commonly used JWPUB file is the S-34, but any JWPUB file can be used here.
manage-media.customDesc: ... allow you to browse to (or drag and drop) any other media file(s) from your computer.
manage-media.customNote: Note that all PDF and SVG files will automatically be converted into high-resolution images by M¬≥.
manage-media.removeHideShowDesc: To remove, hide, or show media, simply find the media file you don't want, and click on the relevant icon.
manage-media.mediaAdded: The media file was added to that day's media by you or the VO.
manage-media.mediaClicked:
Click on the red üü• (delete) icon to delete the file.
Click a second time to confirm.
manage-media.mediaRef: The media file is referenced in the meeting's material.
manage-media.mediaDownload: It will be downloaded from JW.org or extracted from the relevant publication.
manage-media.mediaHidden: It was hidden by you or the VO, so it will not be downloaded or added to the meeting's media.
manage-media.screenshots: Screenshots of the media management screen
manage-media.imgAddSong: Adding a song for a public talk
manage-media.imgImportJWPUB: Importing media from a section in a JWPUB file
manage-media.imgPreviewJWPUB: Previewing media from a JWPUB file before importing

present-media.presentMode: The media presentation and controller modes are designed for simplicity and to prevent mistakes during meetings.
present-media.presentModeEnabled: Once the option [PRESENT] is enabled, the media presentation screen will automatically appear on the external monitor if present, or in a separate, draggable and resizable window if no external monitor was detected.
present-media.presentStandby: When in standby, the media presentation screen will display the background image that is configured in the settings. If no background image has been configured, then M¬≥ will attempt to automatically fetch and display the yeartext.
present-media.presentBG: If no background image is configured in the settings and the yeartext could not be loaded automatically, a black background will be displayed when on standby.
present-media.presentControls: Media controller mode can be accessed by clicking the ‚ñ∂Ô∏è (play) button on the main screen of M¬≥, or by using the keyboard shortcut <kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>D</kbd> (for external display).
present-media.folderSelect: Once you have entered controller mode, the folder selection screen will allow you to select the date for which you'd like to display media.
present-media.folderCurrentDay: If the current day's folder exists, it will automatically be preselected.
present-media.folderSelected: Once a date is selected, you can still change the selected date at any time by clicking on the date selection button, in the top section.
present-media.mediaPlay: To play media, press the ‚ñ∂Ô∏è (play) button for the file you'd like.
present-media.mediaHide: To hide the media, press the ‚èπÔ∏è (stop) button.
present-media.mediaVideo: A video can be rewound or fast-forwarded while paused, if desired.
present-media.mediaVideoNote: Please note that for videos, the stop button must be pressed twice to prevent accidentally and prematurely stopping a video while it is playing for the congregation.
present-media.mediaVideoStop: Videos will auto-stop when they have played in their entirety.
present-media.mediaButtons: The bottom right has the "home" button, which will exit media controller mode, as well as the "hide/show media presentation window" button.
present-media.m3ZoomOBS: Conducting hybrid meetings using a combination of M¬≥, OBS Studio, and Zoom
present-media.together: By far the simplest way to share media during hybrid meetings is by configuring OBS Studio, M¬≥ and Zoom to work together.
present-media.monitor: Set the external monitor's screen resolution to 1280x720, or something close to that.
present-media.sound: Configure the computer sound card's output to go to one of the sound booth mixer's inputs, and the sound booth mixer's combined output to go to the computer's sound card input.
present-media.obsInstall: Install OBS Studio, or download the portable version.
present-media.obsVirtualCam: If using the portable version of OBS Studio, install the [Virtualcam] plugin, and if using the portable version of OBS Studio, add the virtual camera to Windows by double-clicking the provided installation script.
present-media.obsWebsocket: Install the [obs-websocket] plugin. For the moment, v5 is not supported in M¬≥, so make sure that you install the latest version of v4 (currently v4.9.1-compat) to avoid any issues. Configure a port number and password for obs-websocket.
present-media.obsSettings: In the OBS settings, under General > System Tray, enable all checkboxes. Under Output > Streaming, enable a hardware encoder if available.
present-media.obsSettingsVideo: Under Video > Base (Canvas) Resolution and Output (Scaled) Resolution, choose 1280x720, and under Downscale Filter, choose Bilinear.
present-media.obsScenes: Set up at least 2 scenes: one for the media display (Window Capture or Display Capture with the mouse cursor disabled and the appropriate window title/monitor selected), and one for the stage view (Video Capture Device with the KH camera selected).
present-media.obsMoreScenes: You may add as many scenes as required, with the camera adjusted, zoomed-in and cropped as needed (lectern view, conductor and reader view, table view, etc.).
present-media.obsShortcut: Add a shortcut to OBS Studio, with the --startvirtualcam parameter, to the Startup folder of the Windows user profile, to ensure that OBS Studio gets started automatically when the user logs in.
present-media.zoomMonitors: Zoom should be configured to use dual monitors.
present-media.zoomShortcuts: Enable global keyboard shortcuts for Zoom to mute/unmute the Kingdom Hall audio in Zoom (<kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>A</kbd>), and start/stop the Kingdom Hall video feed in Zoom (<kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>V</kbd>).
present-media.zoomMicVid: Set the default "microphone" to be sound booth mixer's combined output (so that everything that is heard over the Kingdom Hall sound system is transmitted over Zoom, including microphones and media) and the "camera" to be the virtual camera provided by OBS Studio.
present-media.enableOBS: Enable and configure OBS Studio compatibility mode, using the port and password information configured in the OBS Studio configuration step.
present-media.configureScenes: Configure which scene is set up as the media window scene in OBS, and which scene should be the default view that will be activated when media presentation mode starts.
present-media.startZoom: Start the Zoom meeting, and move the secondary Zoom meeting window to the external monitor. Make it fullscreen if desired.
present-media.zoomDesc: This is where any remote meeting participants will be displayed for the congregation to see.
present-media.openM3: Once the Zoom meeting is being displayed on the external monitor, open M¬≥.
present-media.autoOpen: The media presentation window will automatically open on top of Zoom on the external monitor.
present-media.sync: Sync media if necessary, and enter media controller mode by clicking the ‚ñ∂Ô∏è (play) button on the main screen of M¬≥, or <kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>D</kbd>.
present-media.enableFeed: Enable the Kingdom Hall video feed (<kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>V</kbd>), and spotlight the Kingdom Hall video feed if necessary so that Zoom participants see the Kingdom Hall stage.
present-media.enableMic: Unmute the Kingdom Hall audio feed in Zoom (<kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>A</kbd>). It should not be necessary to disable the video or audio feed in Zoom for the duration of the meeting.
present-media.startMusic: Start background music playback using the button on the bottom left, or <kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>K</kbd>.
present-media.broadcastToZoom: Broadcasting in-person parts from the Kingdom Hall stage over Zoom
present-media.camAngles: Various camera angles/zoom can be chosen during the meeting by using the menu on the bottom of the M¬≥ media playback control window; this menu will contain a list of all configured camera view scenes in OBS.
present-media.shareMedia: Sharing media at the Kingdom Hall and over Zoom
present-media.findMedia: Find the media you want to share in the M¬≥ media playback control window, and press the "play" button.
present-media.stopMedia: When you're done sharing media, press the "stop" button in M¬≥. Note that videos automatically stop upon completion.
present-media.showZoomParts: Displaying remote Zoom participants on the Kingdom Hall monitor
present-media.hideShow: Press the "hide/show media presentation window" button in the lower right corner of the M¬≥ media controller screen, or Alt Z, to hide the media presentation window.
present-media.zoomVisible: The Zoom meeting will now be visible on the Kingdom Hall monitor.
present-media.zoomPartWithMedia: If the participant has media to show, follow the steps under the [SHAREMEDIA] subheading.
present-media.zoomPartFinished: Once the participant has finished their part, press the "hide/show media presentation window" button in the lower right corner of the M¬≥ media playback control window, or Alt Z, to show the media presentation window.
present-media.yeartextVisible: The Kingdom Hall monitor will now show the yeartext.
present-media.onlyZoomM3: Conducting hybrid meetings using only M¬≥ and Zoom
present-media.noOBS: If you do not wish to use OBS Studio for any reason, the following suggestions will perhaps help you to set things up as simply as possible.
present-media.sameAddition: With the addition of the global keyboard shortcut for Zoom for starting/stopping screen sharing (<kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>S</kbd>). The "camera" will be the camera feed from the Kingdom Hall camera.
present-media.startShare: Start sharing in Zoom by hitting <kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>S</kbd>.
present-media.selectMonitor: In the Zoom sharing window that pops up, choose the external monitor and enable both checkboxes on the bottom left (for sound and video optimization).
present-media.yeartextShared: The yeartext will now be shared over Zoom.
present-media.stopSharing: When you're done sharing media, hit <kbd>Alt</kbd> <kbd>S</kbd> to end Zoom screen sharing.
present-media.imgButton: Button to enter media controller mode
present-media.imgSelectMeeting: Selecting a meeting for which to display media
present-media.imgBG: Default media background, with automatically generated yeartext
present-media.imgMediaList: List of media that is ready to be presented
present-media.imgStandby: M¬≥ media presentation in standby mode
present-media.imgVideoScrub: Moving to a specific time in a video
